intro: Sanguisorba guestphalica, commonly known as the German sorrel or bloodwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its distinctive leaf structure and flowering habits. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a reddish underside and produces clusters of small, pinkish-red flowers in late summer. Sanguisorba guestphalica is often found in moist meadows and woodland edges, thriving in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it a notable species for both ecological and horticultural purposes.
